thread.title: Home fans expected to provide ‘adrenaline’ for jet-lagged Mets
thread.title_full: Home fans expected to provide ‘adrenaline’ for jet-lagged Mets | New York Post

author: Mike Puma
title: Home fans expected to provide ‘adrenaline’ for jet-lagged Mets
text:
Flying is for the birds.
After four transcontinental flights in less than nine days in the NLDS win over the Dodgers, Mets manager Terry Collins admitted his team was dragging Friday as it prepared for Saturday’s Game 1 of the NLCS against the Cubs at Citi Field.
“I put my head on the pillow this morning at 9:30 and got to be here now,” Collins said during a late-afternoon press conference.
“But we’ve got a night off and this place is going to be fueled with a lot of energy [Saturday] night. I think we’ll be able to use that as a little medicine to find some extra adrenaline for sure.”
Juan Uribe hasn’t improved enough from his chest injury to warrant inclusion on the NLCS roster, according to general manager Sandy Alderson. The deadline to submit rosters is 10 a.m. Saturday.
